title: rustc panic due to attempt to take value of `char_at`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
I came across this while making a typo. I had intended to write `.char_at(pos)` instead of `.char_at[pos]`. As follows:

```
Users/rkrn/nlp/src/faststr/search.rs:15:23: 15:30 error: attempted to take value of method `char_at` on type `&str`
/Users/rkrn/nlp/src/faststr/search.rs:15               pattern.char_at[pos] != pattern.char_at[pos-shift] {
                                                                               ^~~~~~~
/Users/rkrn/nlp/src/faststr/search.rs:15:30: 15:30 help: maybe a `()` to call it is missing? If not, try an anonymous function
/Users/rkrn/nlp/src/faststr/search.rs:15:47: 15:54 error: attempted to take value of method `char_at` on type `&str`
/Users/rkrn/nlp/src/faststr/search.rs:15               pattern.char_at[pos] != pattern.char_at[pos-shift] {
                                                                                                       ^~~~~~~
/Users/rkrn/nlp/src/faststr/search.rs:15:54: 15:54 help: maybe a `()` to call it is missing? If not, try an anonymous function
error: internal compiler error: no type for expr in fcx 0x10dfef698
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
```

Hope this is useful!
